name: Rosetta Stone
description: A granodiorite stele inscribed with three versions of a decree issued in Memphis, Egypt in 196 BC.
significance: Key to deciphering Egyptian hieroglyphs, unlocking the secrets of ancient Egyptian civilization.

name: Antikythera Mechanism
description: An ancient Greek analogue computer used to predict astronomical positions and eclipses.
significance: Demonstrates the sophisticated mechanical engineering capabilities of ancient Greece.

name: Tutankhamun's Death Mask
description: A gold funeral mask worn over the face and shoulders of the mummy of Pharaoh Tutankhamun.
significance: One of the most recognizable symbols of ancient Egypt and royal burial practices.

name: Terracotta Army
description: A collection of terracotta sculptures depicting the armies of Qin Shi Huang, the first Emperor of China.
location: Mausoleum of the First Qin Emperor, Xi'an
significance: Reveals the military organization and artistic achievements of ancient China.

name: Dead Sea Scrolls
description: Ancient Jewish religious manuscripts found in the Qumran Caves near the Dead Sea.
significance: Provide insights into Judaism and early Christianity, including the oldest known biblical manuscripts.

name: Stonehenge
description: A prehistoric monument consisting of a ring of standing stones in Wiltshire, England.
significance: Demonstrates sophisticated prehistoric engineering and possible astronomical alignments.
